article.headline: American U. 82, Lehigh 75
article.story: WASHINGTON -- Vlad Moldoveanu scored 29 of his career-high 39 points in the second half to lead American University to a 82-75 victory over Lehigh on Saturday in the Patriot League opener. Stephen Lumpkins added 16 points to help the Eagles (11-5, 1-0) to their fourth-straight win in a meeting of the last three conference champions. C.J. McCollum nearly matched Moldoveanu, scoring 23 of his 32 points after halftime as the Mountain Hawks (9-7, 0-1) suffered their first loss in four games, and their first defeat to American since Feb. 7, 2009. Mackey McKnight and Holden Greiner added 11 points each for Lehigh, which won last season's league title, after American won it in 2008 and 2009. American trailed by as many as six points early in the second half, but Moldoveanu scored 19 of his team's 21 points during a stretch when the Eagles transformed a 47-44 deficit into a 65-55 lead.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
